summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on July 11, 2019. It demands the production of Jeffrey Epstein's email correspondence and all audio recordings/records of his telephone calls from July 6-11, 2019, while excluding communications with his attorneys. The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The incarcerated individual (76318-054) whose email correspondence and telephone call records from July 6-11, 2019, are being subpoenaed by the grand jury.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the grand jury subpoena and accompanying letter requesting confidentiality.

persons.name: Marc Fernich
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys; communications between Epstein and this attorney are specifically excluded from the records being subpoenaed.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys; communications between Epstein and this attorney are specifically excluded from the records being subpoenaed.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys; communications between Epstein and this attorney are specifically excluded from the records being subpoenaed.

persons.name: Eric Blachman
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent designated to receive the subpoenaed records if produced in lieu of a personal appearance before the grand jury.

connections.description: Marc Fernich is listed as one of Epstein's attorneys; their communications are legally protected and excluded from the subpoena.
Martin Weinberg is listed as one of Epstein's attorneys; their communications are legally protected and excluded from the subpoena.
Reid Weingarten is listed as one of Epstein's attorneys; their communications are legally protected and excluded from the subpoena.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is the official leading the grand jury investigation into Epstein, resulting in the issuance of this subpoena for his records.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to the Metropolitan Correctional Center for Jeffrey Epstein's email and phone records from July 6-11, 2019.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands the MCC to appear before the grand jury on this date to produce records, though a personal appearance is waived if records are provided to Special Agent Eric Blachman.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, New York, New York
The Silvio J. Mollo Building (One Saint Andrew's Plaza), New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A federal grand jury was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein for suspected felonies under statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement) as of July 11, 2019.

The subpoena specifically seeks all of Epstein's email and telephone call records from July 6-11, 2019, but excludes communications with his attorneys Marc Fernich, Martin Weinberg, and Reid Weingarten to protect attorney-client privilege.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested that the MCC voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.
Epstein was an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York under register number 76318-054 at the time the subpoena was issued.
The document includes a 'Declaration of Custodian of Records' form to authenticate the business records provided in response to the subpoena under the Federal Rules of Evidence.
